title: Graeme Souness insists Liverpool got 'bossed' by Manchester United in midfield
text:
Graeme Souness believes Liverpool were fortunate to leave Old Trafford with a point after being 'bossed' by Manchester United in Sunday's 1-1 draw.

United took the lead through Marcus Rashford's 36th minute goal and it appeared that Liverpool's unbeaten start to the Premier League season would be brought to an end.

Substitute Adam Lallana earned Liverpool a point, but Souness stressed that Liverpool 'got away with it' after being dominated in midfield by United.

Graeme Souness believes Liverpool were fortunate not to be beaten by Manchester United

Substitute Adam Lallana scored in the 85th minute as Liverpool drew 1-1 at Old Trafford

Speaking on Sky Sports, Souness said: 'I think Liverpool got away with it today. United didn’t allow Liverpool to get into the game at all. They were bossed in there today (midfield). It would be hard on Liverpool not to get anything from the game.

'But I think United will take a lot from that game. They showed they can be organised and did carry a threat. United did a great job on Liverpool’s full backs, they stopped them for most of the game. I think Liverpool got away with it today.'

Former United defender Gary Neville added that he didn't expect United to adopt such a positive approach.

Former Manchester United defender Gary Neville was surprised his old side were so positive

Neville said: 'We didn’t think they’d be anywhere near as positive as they were in that back five. They were really positive from the first five minutes. He got it absolutely right, the game plan worked.

'United will be happy, Ole will be happy. If United had conceded 15 minutes earlier I think Liverpool would have gone on to win that game.'

The 1-1 draw saw Liverpool's 17 game winning run in the Premier League come to an end, with United producing an encouraging display.

Following the game Liverpool are six points clear of second place Manchester City, while United are in 13th.
description: Graeme Souness believes Liverpool were fortunate to leave Old Trafford with a point after being 'bossed' by Manchester United in Sunday's 1-1 draw.
